name: df-slw
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3
body: |- wceq(cslw, cmpo(s0, s1, cprime, cgrp, crab(s2, cfv(csubg, cv(s1)), wral(s3, cfv(csubg, cv(s1)), wb(wa(wss(cv(s2), cv(s3)), wbr(cv(s0), cpgp, co(cv(s1), cress, cv(s3)))), wceq(cv(s2), cv(s3)))))))
bodyPretty: ⊢ pSyl =(s0 ∈ Prime, s1 ∈ Grp ↦ { s2 ∈(SubGrp ` s1)| ∀(s3 ∈(SubGrp ` s1),((s2 ⊆ s3 ∧ s0[pGrp](s1[|`s]s3))↔ s2 = s3))})
comment: Define the set of Sylow p-subgroups of a group ` g ` . A Sylow p-subgroup is a p-group that is not a subgroup of any other p-groups in ` g ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 16-Jan-2015.)
